clinical_study.brief_title: Narrow Band Green Light and Migraine
clinical_study.official_title: A Real World Evaluation of the Allay Lamp in Reducing Headache Symptoms and Frequency

brief_summary.textblock: Study volunteers are asked to use the Allay Lamp routinely during the 6-week study period. A web based survey is provided when the Lamp is purchased for study volunteers to complete. A daily usage paper diary is sent with the lamp so that volunteers can keep track of the frequency and duration of lamp usage and any noticeable benefits. At the end of six weeks a second survey is sent to study volunteers to capture their perceptions of potential lamp benefits with respect to headache frequency and their experience of migraine specific symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in number of headache days per week
primary_outcome.description: Number of days with headache per week without and with using the Allay lamp

primary_outcome.measure: Change in number of headache days per month
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at weeks 3-6 of using the Allay lamp
primary_outcome.description: Number of days with headache per month without and with using the Allay lamp

primary_outcome.measure: Change in frequency of experiencing photophobia
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6 weeks of using the Allay Lamp.
primary_outcome.description: Assessing frequency of photophobia during days with headache as depicted by participants using the following options: (1)never, rarely, (2)less than half, (3)half or more, (4)nearly all the time.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 6 weeks of using the Allay lamp
primary_outcome.description: Assessing headache severity while using the Allay lamp. Improvement is determined by the number of times participants answer Yes or NO in their daily diary.

arm_group.description: Subjects who purchased the Allay Lamp are asked to document the effects of spending time in the narrow band of green light it emits, on their headache or any of its associated symptoms.

intervention.description: The Allay Lamp is a consumer product currently available and widely used in the US. It emits low intensity (1-10 lux) narrow band (20 nm) green light (peak wavelength 520 nm) that is marketed as non-irritating to users. In that context, it is not a medical device and does not require a 510(k).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults with headaches or migraines.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not having headaches or migraines
